definition: to have the courage to do sth/to dare to/bold in
to go/to take/sentence-final interrogative particle/variant of 於|于[yu2]

sentences.english: We must be bold in "hard money" and not to doubt their own.
sentences.chinese: 要敢于“硬干”，不要怀疑自己。

sentences.english: I really admire your courage in biting your toe nail in public.
sentences.chinese: 我真信服你敢于在平易近众场所咬脚趾甲的勇气。

sentences.english: Honest, positive, detailed and courage to meet challenge.
sentences.chinese: 诚笃，踊跃，仔细，敢于接管挑战。

sentences.english: If you dare to use that word in my hearing again, we part brass rags .
sentences.chinese: 如果你敢于当着我的面说那个词，咱俩就一刀两断。

sentences.english: Nale:I want my brother to suffer for daring to oppose me.
sentences.chinese: 我要我的兄弟因为敢于反抗我而受到折磨。

sentences.english: "Innovative, brave in exploitation" is our persistent pursuit.
sentences.chinese: “敢于创新，勇于开拓”是我执著的追求。

sentences.english: Dare to face the reality, have the courage to take responsibility, will progress.
sentences.chinese: 罂敢于面对现实，勇于承担责任，才会不断进步。

sentences.english: At that time, because they dare to emancipate the mind, is very valuable.
sentences.chinese: 因为当时他们敢于解放思想，也是非常难能可贵的。

sentences.english: Real man dare to combatant and he knows also to protect himself and family.
sentences.chinese: 真男人要敢于拼搏，也要懂得保护自己和家人。

sentences.english: I wonder if he dare stand up to his boss.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道他是否敢于反抗他的老板。

sentences.english: As if somebody has dictated hard conditions, has commended some risk taking.
sentences.chinese: 至于如果有人硬条件决定的，已表彰了一批敢于冒险。

sentences.english: So, if we want to succeed in life, we must be brave to win.
sentences.chinese: 所以，如果我们想在生活中成功，我们必须敢于胜利。

sentences.english: And I resolved to be cautious how I ventured under those rafters a third time.
sentences.chinese: 我决心在第三次敢于再来到这屋里时可要小心谨严。

sentences.english: Next week he should dare to make himself much more unpopular on the left.
sentences.chinese: 下周，他应该敢于让自己在左翼人士中更加不受欢迎。

sentences.english: If any were bald enough to object, he would threaten them with the Japanese.
sentences.chinese: 倘若有人敢于反抗，他就以日本人的淫威相胁迫。

sentences.english: Befriending failure makes you dare to try new things.
sentences.chinese: 失败让你敢于挑战更新的东西。

definition: to dare to/to be brave enough to
to speak bluntly (idiom)/not to mince words
see 冒大不韙|冒大不韪[mao4 da4 bu4 wei3]
pinyin: mao4 tian1 xia4 zhi1 da4 bu4 wei3

definition: to deserve praise for one's courage (idiom)
